Knowing the function \\( y(t) \\) at a specific time t, can we determine the initial value \\( y(0) \\) without knowledge of the full history from 0 to t?
Explanation: The solution \\( y(t) \\) at any time t depends on the entire history from 0 to t due to the integral part of the equation. Therefore, without knowledge of the function values between 0 and t, the initial value \\( y(0) \\) cannot be uniquely determined.
